column4: GRUB2 question: I have set the TIMEOUT=0 and the DEFAULT=0 (Windows). Can I still boot Ubuntu? I have just tried holding Shift all through the boot process, and a change DOES occur: I get the message "GRUB loading...". However, this disappears after 5 or so seconds and continues with it's configured boot process (i.e. it does not show the GRUB menu)
one thing you could do is legthen the timeout by boot live usb/cd and change params in /boot directory
or change the default boot to be ubuntu
I think Chuck_Norris is correct it's at /etc/default/grub
